950bce3b-6d51-40be-afac-64f65490dcad.description: Earners of this digital badge have joined the Sigma Iota Epsilon - Sigma Zeta Chapter. Sigma Iota Epsilon is the National Honorary and Professional Management Society; known for its encouragement and recognition of scholastic excellence and the promotion of cooperation between the academic and practical aspects of management. Sigma Zeta members have shown scholastic excellence in their study of business management and a desire to develop and support excellence in the field of management.
950bce3b-6d51-40be-afac-64f65490dcad.name: Sigma Iota Epsilon - Sigma Zeta Chapter Member

badge_template_activities.title: Undergraduate Students: Achieved a GPA of  3.25 or higher, completed 30 hours of education toward undergraduate degree, completed 6 semester hours of management curriculum with a grade of B or higher at University of Dallas.
Graduate Students:  Achieved a GPA of at least 3.5, and have completed at least nine semester hours of graduate work, including at least six hours in management courses at the University of Dallas.
A one time membership fee must be paid when submitting the application.
Participation in the SIE Initiation ceremony at the University of Dallas.

faa63d31-e416-444b-8c3d-1d9d4445c143.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to incorporate ethical and socially responsible decision making based on qualitative and quantitative data in a leadership environment.
faa63d31-e416-444b-8c3d-1d9d4445c143.name: Leading Ethical Change

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Business and Society, Data Analysis for Decision Making, and Effective Leader courses or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Devise detailed strategies for organizations to significantly enhance life and well-being of its members and remaining profitable
Develop sustainable and socially responsible strategies for companies to maintain their competitive advantage

83ebed20-da3e-41d8-a218-55357d80c0c0.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to effectively transform information into financial statements, create and manage budgets for business operations, analyze risk vs. return to maximize firm value, and explore ways to manage resources to enhance firm value.
83ebed20-da3e-41d8-a218-55357d80c0c0.name: Business Analyst

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Accounting for Managers, Managerial Finance, and Management of Operations courses or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Analyze company performance using profitability ratios.
Assess a firm's cash flow to drive cash management and capital investment strategies.
Evaluate the acquisition, management, and transformation of resources.
Assess and forecast operational performance and create lean supply chain systems.

f6eb1620-6975-48f4-b517-25b3df99d429.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to plan, evaluate, and implement improvements for human resource initiatives, devise and implement strategy for managing the operations of a multi-national enterprise, and apply ROI concepts to deliver high levels of marketing productivity and profitability.
f6eb1620-6975-48f4-b517-25b3df99d429.name: Business Strategist

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Global Strategy, Managing Complex Organization, and Value Based Marketing courses or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Develop a customer-focused strategy that drives customer retention and profitability.
Develop organizational strategies that create employee engagement.
Evaluate a firm's environmental position (Strengths, Weaknesses, Opportunities and Threats) to drive organizational strategy.
Create and implement a balanced scorecard to evaluate a firm's performance on numerous metrics.

cf86856f-8386-45f6-8344-f7fbf2fb473c.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated a detailed understanding of secure network infrastructures and the components necessary to develop a defense strategy that includes selection, use and placement of devices, network monitoring, access controls, global, federal and state legal and regulatory compliance requirements.
cf86856f-8386-45f6-8344-f7fbf2fb473c.name: Cyber Operations

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Compliance & Legal Issues, Operational Cybersecurity Management, and Network Security courses at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.

Successful completion of labs configuring an active directory domain controller, managing windows accounts and organizational units, configuring windows file system permissions, managing group policy objectives in active directory, configuring windows firewall, managing and configuring Linux file system permissions, encrypting and decrypting files with PKI, encrypting and decrypting web traffic with HTTPS.
Reverse engineering cyber breach cases identifying the risk and vulnerabilities.

5b96f64f-510d-489c-a210-2a737a9c4389.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated an expertise in penetration testing and vulnerability protection, digital forensics, strategic cyber planning, implementation, and executive communications and decision making.
5b96f64f-510d-489c-a210-2a737a9c4389.name: Cyber Defense

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Penetration Testing & Vulnerability, Digital Forensics, and Strategic Cybersecurity Practicum courses at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Successful completion of attacking a vulnerable web application and database.
Design a business continuity and disaster recovery plan for key assets.
Design a business continuity and disaster recovery plan for key assets.

6e2b76a1-5f1b-495d-aca1-2707fa83429b.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to effectively identify and reduce risk with effective cybersecurity processes, procedures, cryptography, and techniques maintaining the confidentiality, integrity, and availability (CIA) of electronic data.
6e2b76a1-5f1b-495d-aca1-2707fa83429b.name: Cyber Essentials

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Foundations of Cybersecurity or equivalent, Foundations of Management Strategy or equivalent and Data Protection courses at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.

Successful completion of  labs requiring performing reconnaissance and probing, performing a vulnerability assessment, enabling windows active directory and user access controls, performing packet capture and traffic analysis.
Successful completion of labs eliminating threats with a layered approach.
Perform basic key exchanges and the use of cryptographic hashes.

8bd3f199-6c43-45dd-a6a8-62e307299800.description: Data Analysts have demonstrated the ability to effectively use SAS, Tableau and Excel to perform complex data manipulation & analysis and visually present the results for effective decision making.
8bd3f199-6c43-45dd-a6a8-62e307299800.name: Data Analyst I

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Data Analysis for Decision Making, Quantitative Methods, and Data Visualization courses or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Build an interactive dashboard and data story using Tableau.

8e1bb98e-97d5-4b94-b25a-e404e82478fa.description: Financial Analyst I have demonstrated the ability to effectively analyze complicated accounting reports and financial data, and further develop financial models to make business decisions on financial budgeting, working capital, cost of capital, and risk management.
8e1bb98e-97d5-4b94-b25a-e404e82478fa.name: Financial Analyst I

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Accounting for Managers, Intermediate Financial Accounting, and Managerial Finance courses or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Gupta College of Business.
Completion of financial statement analysis and 10K analysis of a public company.
Completion of a financial report on a public company about financial budgeting, working capital analysis, cost of capital analysis, and risk management strategies.

6023cbfa-fe59-4bc0-b9dd-877acaffbbc9.description: Data Modelers have demonstrated the ability to effectively use various forecasting techniques, machine learning techniques, model tuning, and validation.
6023cbfa-fe59-4bc0-b9dd-877acaffbbc9.name: Data Modeler

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Forecasting Methods, Predictive Modeling, and Advanced Business Analytics courses, or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Completion of a time-series forecasting project using either R or SAS Enterprise Guide
Completion of a machine learning project using R, BigML, or SAS
Completion of a advanced analytics project using SAS Enterprise Guide and Microsoft Excel

e31a705c-1a48-4003-ac9a-915d0f1f61b2.description: Data Analysts II have demonstrated the ability to effectively use Google Big Query,Python, R, SAS, and SQL and build data models for effective decision making.
e31a705c-1a48-4003-ac9a-915d0f1f61b2.name: Data Analyst II

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Python & R Programming Concepts, Advanced SAS Programming, and Big Data Analytics courses or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business
Completion of data management projects using SQL, PROC SQL and SAS Macros.
Completion of large data set projects using cloud-based data warehouse and analytics platforms.

ff22728b-7e64-49b8-93d2-a0904b708321.description: IT Business Analyst have demonstrated proficiency in translating business needs into IT language, creating, analyzing, and improving maps of business processes, develop and defend decisions about project charters, stakeholder registries, requirements management, work breakdown structures, project budgets, and managing them to a project's completion.
ff22728b-7e64-49b8-93d2-a0904b708321.name: IT Business Analyst

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Programming Concepts, IT Project Management, and Process Mapping and Management courses, or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Successful completion of a project involving value-added analysis, process mapping, lean process management using six sigma techniques, root cause analysis, sustainability, and commercialization.
Successful completion of a project involving IT development, project charter, WBS, requirements gathering, Gantt chart, timelines, budgeting, milestones, and critical path.
Completion of weekly programming assignments using Python.
Successful presentation of process mapping, project management, technology impact analysis, benchmarking, and error proofing, including management changes.

5970d534-4ec1-4565-a250-357e12954b31.description: Advanced IT Business Analysts have demonstrated proficiency in technology selection and roadmapping enterprise architecture analysis using several frameworks (TOGAF). IT metrics development, maturity analysis, and IT Governance design to enhance business strategy.
5970d534-4ec1-4565-a250-357e12954b31.name: Advanced IT Business Analyst

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Future Trends in Technology, Enterprise Architecture, and Strategy and IT Governance courses, or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Successful completion of a semester long project in designing an Enterprise Architecture.
Critically analyze cases of failed IT governance attempts and make recommendations for remediation.
Select technology from among alternatives for an organization.
Develop roadmaps for emerging technologies for surveillance for several future time-frames.
Successful presentation of governance analyses, technology-trends, technology selections, and technology roadmaps.

00ceb3c1-aa4f-45fa-adc7-21c45fe9520f.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated an understanding and application of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) to Corporate financial reporting and presentation, as well as, financial reporting for other specialized areas such as business combinations, partnerships, governmental, and not-for-profit.
00ceb3c1-aa4f-45fa-adc7-21c45fe9520f.name: Financial Accountant

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Intermediate Financial Accounting I, Intermediate Financial Accounting II, and Advanced Accounting, or equivalent courses at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Completion of annual report project including financial statement analysis of competing public companies
Completion of a data analytics case using Microsoft Excel and visualization software
Completion of business combination analysis for 100% ownership and less than 100% ownership scenarios

e96446ef-2be2-4482-9651-ca449e55c443.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the understanding of all levels of assurance services, focus on internal controls, determination of materiality, risk assessment, knowledge of governing bodies, informative systems, audit procedures, business ethics, and audit reports.
e96446ef-2be2-4482-9651-ca449e55c443.name: Assurance Services

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Auditing, Accounting Information Systems, and Business Ethics for Accountants courses, or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Successful completion of an audit work paper from a team case study.
Successful completion of Systems Understanding - Aid Preparation of Journal Entries in manual and cloud environments.

16158b59-d8cd-46e5-9e73-a6a171f7ac8d.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to do compliance, research, and planning for a variety of taxable entities.
16158b59-d8cd-46e5-9e73-a6a171f7ac8d.name: Tax Strategist

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Introduction to Taxation, Entity Tax, and Accounting Research Methods, or equivalent courses at the University of Dallas Satish & Yasmin Gupta College of Business.
Completion of research projects using multiple computer-assisted legal data bases including RIA Checkpoint and Lexis-Nexis

Completion of ethical analysis of a tax practitioner’s activities considering the AICPA Code of Professional Conduct, Statements on Standards for Tax Services and the US Department of Treasury’s Circular 230
Completion of individual, corporate, partnership and estate tax returns using computer-assisted software

94f99915-13d0-45bf-99a1-caa82c8732c2.description: Portfolio Managers have demonstrated the ability to effectively develop various asset pricing models including stock, bond and derivatives, synthesize asset allocation strategies, and construct/re-balance investment portfolio based on investment policy statement.
94f99915-13d0-45bf-99a1-caa82c8732c2.name: Portfolio Manager

badge_template_activities.title: Successful Completion of Investments, Derivatives, and Portfolio Management courses or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Gupta College of Business.

Completion of the StockTrak project with thorough understanding of capital market expectations, bond valuation, bond portfolio management, stock valuation, stock portfolio management, derivatives valuation and risk management.
Actively manage over $100,000 in the Student Managed Investment Fund (SMIF) to maximize the fund portfolio return while minimizing the investment risk.

0429800e-9bdf-406c-9038-6d3feac698fd.description: Financial Analyst II have demonstrated the ability to effectively make advanced financial decisions on capital budgeting, lease financing, mergers and acquisitions, corporate valuations, capital structure theory, dividend policy, risk management, and multinational financial management.
0429800e-9bdf-406c-9038-6d3feac698fd.name: Financial Analyst II

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of Intermediate Managerial Finance, Corporate Valuation, and International Financial Markets courses or equivalent at the University of Dallas Satish & Gupta College of Business.
Completion of  case studies in making financial decisions on capital budgeting, DCF analysis, hybrid financing, refinancing and leasing.
Completion of business simulation to manage all aspects of financial issues of a multinational corporation,  to explore international opportunities and risks on exchange rate fluctuations.

Successful completion of Blackstone simulation on valuation methods including capital cash flow and equity cash flow methods, LBO Models, deal structuring/financing, due diligence, mergers and acquisitions strategy, and negotiation.

fdee9f84-511a-482b-ac0b-4d79311a6cb1.description: Earners of this badge have demonstrated the ability to apply good communications practices through effective use of interpersonal effectiveness, conflict resolution, team building, and emotional intelligence strategies. The Business Communication Badge was developed for Prospanica by the University of Dallas.
fdee9f84-511a-482b-ac0b-4d79311a6cb1.name: Prospanica Webinar Series: Business Communications

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in a 4 part webinar series that include – Interpersonal Effectiveness; Conflict Management; Effective Team Building; and Emotional Intelligence.
Successfully complete online assessment for each of the webinars.

d182b8ef-11ba-44a0-bc6e-407aa46d2c46.description: The Leadership through Crisis Badge was developed for Prospanica by University of Dallas faculty to provide a sound knowledge base on how to effectively lead during a time of turmoil and unrest. Earners of this badge gain an understanding of the importance of creating a supportive environment for their teams and themselves, making sound decisions, and bridging differences effectively. The skills earned are discussed in one-hour long sessions with subject matter experts.
d182b8ef-11ba-44a0-bc6e-407aa46d2c46.name: Leadership Through Crisis

badge_template_activities.title: • Actively participate in a 4-part webinar series that include – Strategizing for Uncertainty through Organizational Finances, Having the Difficult Conversations, Coaching your Teams to High Performance through Tough Times, and Leading with Resilience Through Difficult Times. Webinars are each 1-hour in length and require participants to answer questions throughout sessions via polls and direct questions to individual participants.
Successfully complete the assessment for each of the four webinars.

737208ee-f5b6-4df2-aa60-535a6a912b90.description: Earners of this badge gain an understanding of how to apply leadership concepts and acquire skills that can be utilized in their role as leaders. A focus on leadership behaviors, team building, communication, coaching, managing conflict, collaboration, situational leadership, and building relationships combined with a series of self-assessments brings together a comprehensive learning experience for anyone wanting to become a more effective leader.
737208ee-f5b6-4df2-aa60-535a6a912b90.name: Practical Leadership (Irving Police Department)

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Practical Leadership program modules created for the Irving Police Department. Require attendance at all in-person training sessions, completion program's of interim assignments, and creation of a Personal Development Plan. (1) Transition to Leadership, (2) Discover Your Strengths, (3) Situational Leadership, (4) Leading Successful Teams, (5) Collaboration / Conflict Management, (6) Maximizing Relationships, (7) Coaching Skills, & (8) Action Planning & Closing.
Creation of a Personal Development Plan.
Participation in on-line threaded discussions, as well as completion of required reading assignments and self-assessments.
Qualifies for 32 TCOLE hours, contact police department TCOLE coordinator for details.

767b35c2-f1bd-43c5-9d91-0bde287e279e.description: Earners of this badge gain an understanding of how to apply leadership concepts and acquire skills that can be utilized in their role as leaders. A focus on leadership behaviors, team building, communication, coaching, managing conflict, collaboration, situational leadership, and building relationships combined with a series of self-assessments brings together a comprehensive learning experience for anyone wanting to become a more effective leader.
767b35c2-f1bd-43c5-9d91-0bde287e279e.name: Practical Leadership (City of Irving)

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of the Practical Leadership program modules created for the Irving Police Department. Require attendance at all in-person training sessions, completion program's of interim assignments, and creation of a Personal Development Plan. (1) Transition to Leadership, (2) Discover Your Strengths, (3) Situational Leadership, (4) Leading Successful Teams, (5) Collaboration / Conflict Management, (6) Maximizing Relationships, (7) Coaching Skills, & (8) Action Planning & Closing.
Creation of a Personal Development Plan.
Participation in on-line threaded discussions, as well as completion of required reading assignments and self-assessments.

d759ebbb-4890-41d0-915b-5441ebf0ea81.description: Earners of the Barriers for Negotiations badge understand psychological and cultural barriers can offer insights that can be harnessed in creating win-win solutions during negotiations. They know how to reframe their views with knowledge and creativity to deliver value for everyone involved. The Barriers for Negotiations badge was developed and facilitiated for Prospanica by University of Dallas Faculty.
d759ebbb-4890-41d0-915b-5441ebf0ea81.name: Barriers in Negotiations

badge_template_activities.title: You can only earn this badge at the 2020 Prospanica Conference & Career Expo by attending the "Reframing Psychological and Cultural Barriers in Negotiations" workshop session on October 14 & October 15, 2020.
Participate in all activities during the Reframing Psychological and Cultural Barriers in Negotiations workshop.

7a9ae6a3-0455-4bab-86c9-67f1e6aff2b6.description: Earners of the Diversity Management badge understand how to define and manage diversity, revise their emotional intelligence practices, and lead effective conversations as the person in charge. The Diversity Management Badge was developed for Prospanica by University of Dallas.
7a9ae6a3-0455-4bab-86c9-67f1e6aff2b6.name: Diversity Management

badge_template_activities.title: You can only earn this badge at the 2019 Prospanica Conference & Career Expo by attending the “Emotional Intelligence & Effective Communication: The Revised Tool Set for Diversity-Focused Managers” session on Wednesday, October 30, 2019.
Participate in all activities during the Emotional Intelligence & Effective Communication: The Revised Tool Set for Diversity-Focused Managers session.

e39a4ee3-c062-4134-aa70-4f92b0b491e3.description: The University of Dallas and Universidad ESAN have partnered to offer the Specialization Course in Digital Marketing certificate. This program consists of four classes with 36-class hours of highly interactive instruction. Earners of this certificate have a solid understanding of digital marketing including website structures, digital campaign administration, sales funnels, search engine implementations, social media strategy frameworks, website/app metrics, and digital marketing programs.
e39a4ee3-c062-4134-aa70-4f92b0b491e3.name: Specialization in Digital Marketing Certificate

badge_template_activities.title: Earners of this badge have successfully completed four classes: (1) Basics of Digital Marketing, (2) Search Engine & Content, (3) Digital Marketing Strategy, at the University of Dallas Center for Executive Education, and (4) Diagnosis, Strategy definition and Marketing operational decisions at the Universidad ESAN.
Explain the difference of Google Keyword Planner & Google Trends.
Create a social media content plan, with recommendations of which platform or media is most appropriate for content for specific marketing goals.
Explain the 10 essential elements of any functional website. Create a written evaluation of elements that are done well, and suggestions on how to improve non-compliant elements.
Create a buyer persona.
Understand what makes a good email marketing campaign; how to grow a company's email list; explain what churn rate is and how it impacts email marketing campaigns.
Analyze websites for (1) Call to action, (2) Landing page, (3) Thank you page elements. Explain the importance of the elements.
Identify email marketing indicators.
Create report identifying the four types of media with examples of each type.
Understand and explain marketing framework elements Outreach, Act, and Convert Tactics.
Assess and develop the Digital Marketing Planning Framework, as well as the tools and measurements it requires.
The final project must include: Plan objectives, strategies, marketing decisions, results, and conclusions about an specific company or entrepreneurship venture.

0ccb7070-add6-47e3-bf94-869c1fa2b421.description: Earners of this badge have learned how to be a well versed communicator that can handle diverse settings and audiences. They can accurately communicating while engaging within various media, being effective in virtual settings, acknowledging the role of emotions, handling conflictive communications, and recognizing and communicating with adults that require a more complex communication technique. The Business Communication Badge was developed for Prospanica by the University of Dallas.
0ccb7070-add6-47e3-bf94-869c1fa2b421.name: Advanced Business Communication for Leaders

badge_template_activities.title: Actively participate in a 4 part webinar series that include – Communication in Risk Management, Communication for Individuals Parts 1 & 2 (Communication is a two-way street: What to do when wires get crossed; Leading with collaboration - Engaging in appropriate and effective communication and conflict management practices in the workplace), and Emotions in Communications.
Successfully complete online assessment for each of the webinars.

1c115537-1459-4cda-ab40-bdc5f34e5a5f.description: Earners of the Clarity within Change badge understand that effective communication is of paramount importance since business environments are in a constant state of flux. They have gained excellent communication skills allowing them to clearly convey their message and put others at ease, without compromising their agency and image. Their communication skills are assets to be drawn on whenever needed. The Clarity within Change badge was developed for Prospanica by University of Dallas Faculty.
1c115537-1459-4cda-ab40-bdc5f34e5a5f.name: Clarity Within Change

badge_template_activities.title: You can only earn this badge at the 2020 Prospanica Conference & Career Expo by attending the "Clarity within Change" workshop sessions on September 29 & September 30, 2021.
Participate in all activities during the Clarity within Change workshop.

a95cd8d5-7b22-468d-ae1e-67d4cad7d375.description: Earners of the Personal Financial Planning Certificate have demonstrated a comprehensive understanding of personal financial planning. They are able to take a holistic approach in creating a complete and comprehensive financial plan; which includes the elements of risk management, investments, retirement, and estate planning, and overall money and wealth management. Badge earners have met the CFP Board education requirement to sit for the CFP exam.
a95cd8d5-7b22-468d-ae1e-67d4cad7d375.name: Personal Financial Planning Certificate

alignments.name: Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards, Inc.
alignments.description: Students who earn this certificate have completed 272 hours of approved education from a CFP Board Registered Education Program; which completes the education portion of CFP Board's requirements to sit for the CFP Exam.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of General Principles of Finance, Insurance Planning, Investment Planning, Income Tax Planning, Retirement Planning, Estate Planning, and CFP Case Study/Capstone courses at the University of Dallas - Executive Education.
Earn a minimum proficiency of 70% on all assignments, case studies, quizzes, and final exam.

Create a complete and comprehensive financial plan as part of the CFP Case Study/Capstone course. Students are required to give a presentation on their financial plan. Their instructor will pose questions about their plan, and students will elaborate on their decisions and defend their work.

NOTICE: The University of Dallas does not certify individuals to use the CFP®, Certified Financial Planner™ and marks. CFP® certification is granted solely by Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards, Inc. to individuals who, in addition to completing an educational requirement such as this CFP Board Registered Program, have met ethics, experience and examination requirements.

576ab561-a64f-4215-9bd9-90f2dd4af074.description: The First Vice President serves as the second-in-command to ensure the accomplishment of all Chapter activities during the academic year. The First Vice President assumes the Presidential role and exercises the required leadership if the current President is unable to. The First Vice President is completely familiar with all strategic and annual Chapter goals and activities; and relationships with the SIE National Office, the University of Dallas and other organizations.
576ab561-a64f-4215-9bd9-90f2dd4af074.name: Sigma Iota Epsilon - First Vice President

badge_template_activities.title: Is a current member of Sigma Iota Epsilon - Sigma Zeta Chapter in good standing.
Leads strategic projects for the Chapter as delegated by the faculty advisor and/or chapter president.

Is completely familiar with all strategic and annual chapter goals and activities, as well as the SIE Constitution and Bylaws. Maintains relationships with the SIE National Office, the host institution, and other organizations.
Mentors all incoming officers and ensures the success of SIE Vice Presidents goals throughout each term.

Participates in strategic meetings with chapter president and faculty advisor in the creation of policy changes, chapter's mission and goals, and ensures chapter remains within scope of its constitution to provide beneficial opportunities to members.

Ensures chapter goals are met and executed effectively. The First Vice President is responsible for the successful completion of networking, professional and career development opportunities, and the promotion of SIE to gain new members.
Participates in the initiation of new members at SIE Sigma Zeta initiation ceremonies.

08af8c3e-d59a-4cfd-80d1-a6cbf60f7075.description: Earners of the Certificate in Financial and Estate Planning have demonstrated a comprehensive understanding of personal financial planning. They are able to take a holistic approach in creating a complete and comprehensive financial plan; which includes the elements of risk management, investments, retirement, and estate planning, and overall money and wealth management. Badge earners have met the CFP Board education requirement to sit for the CFP exam prior to 2011.
08af8c3e-d59a-4cfd-80d1-a6cbf60f7075.name: Certificate in Financial and Estate Planning

alignments.name: Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards, Inc.
alignments.description: Students who earn this certificate have completed 272 hours of approved education from a CFP Board Registered Education Program; which completes the education portion of CFP Board's requirements to sit for the CFP Exam.

badge_template_activities.title: Successful completion of General Principles of Finance, Insurance Planning, Investment Planning, Income Tax Planning, Retirement Planning, and Estate Planning courses at the University of Dallas - Center for Professional Development
Earn a minimum proficiency of 70% on all assignments, case studies, quizzes, and final exam.

NOTICE: The University of Dallas does not certify individuals to use the CFP®, Certified Financial Planner™ and marks. CFP® certification is granted solely by Certified Financial Planner Board of Standards, Inc. to individuals who, in addition to completing an educational requirement such as this CFP Board Registered Program, have met ethics, experience and examination requirements.

64556039-3855-4891-98d5-cfc2a9c4dac2.description: The Chapter Vice President of Alumni Relations is responsible for handling outgoing communication and promoting engagement and continuous relationships with the Chapter Alumni. In this role the VP of Alumni Relations reaches out to SIE Alumni to find speakers for events, prospective committee volunteers, and candidates for various SIE Sigma Zeta events. The VP of Alumni Relations will work closely with the Outward Message Team and chapter President.
64556039-3855-4891-98d5-cfc2a9c4dac2.name: Sigma Iota Epsilon - Vice President Alumni Relations

badge_template_activities.title: Is a current member of Sigma Iota Epsilon - Sigma Zeta Chapter in good standing.

Finds speakers and volunteers for SIE events, including but not limited to Keynote Speaker, Distinguished Alumni, and Mentorship opportunities primarily, but not limited to, LinkedIn and Sigma Zeta LinkedIn Group.

Is the primary point of contact between alumni and current officers. Coordinates introductions, manages all communications with alumni, and ensures alumni are prepared for speaking engagements, workshop, alumni highlights, and events.
Mentors and trains incoming VP of Alumni Relations in role responsibilities to ensure role continuity.
Manages the onboarding for alumni reengagement with chapter for speaking engagements, workshops, Alumni Spotlights, and events.

Responsible for the management of the Sigma Iota Epsilon - Sigma Zeta Chapter LinkedIn Group. This includes admitting new members, coordinating any communications from chapter officers on group to ensure continuous flow of information to members, and posting of upcoming events and Alumni Spotlight.
Works with VP of Marketing and Communications to gather required materials to promote upcoming events, Alumni Spotlights, and posts to send out on LinkedIn.
Participates in the initiation of new members at SIE Sigma Zeta initiation ceremonies.
Creates surveys and questionnaires to collect membership data and preferences when needed.

0d7f552d-986c-4db8-8ef2-59d05a97fdf7.description: The Chapter Vice President of Logistics and Operations is responsible for maintaining records of meeting minutes, events and historical records for SIE SZC. In this role the Chapter Vice President of Logistics and Operations manages all necessary record keeping for the chapter and supports the Chapter President in creation of the yearly report to SIE National. The Chapter Vice President of Logistics and Operations will work closely with the chapter officers, faculty advisor and chapter admin.
0d7f552d-986c-4db8-8ef2-59d05a97fdf7.name: Sigma Iota Epsilon - Vice President Operations

badge_template_activities.title: Is a current member of Sigma Iota Epsilon - Sigma Zeta Chapter in good standing.
Leads strategic projects for the Chapter as delegated by the faculty advisor and/or chapter president.
Maintains an accessible chapter filing system comprised of current membership data, alumni data, past correspondence, suspense items, and National Office materials
Mentors all incoming officers and ensures the success of SIE Vice Presidents goals throughout each term.

Maintains, publishes, and distributes the chapter’s calendar of events (month, semester, year) Documents information of event logistics (numbers of attendees, speakers, topics, event type, feedback) for historical records and for use in preparation of yearly report to SIE National
Responsible for taking meeting minutes and following up on tasks at Officer Meetings.
Responsible for the creation of the yearly report submitted to SIE National Office. Works with Chapter President, First Vice President, and Faculty Advisor.
Participates in the initiation of new members at SIE Sigma Zeta initiation ceremonies.
